bitmark:
[.book]
[@id:227752]
[@externalId:e-complex-tests_10xkpzrlmnlu]
[#Complex tests]
[@language:de]
[@coverImage:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/englisch-hilfen/web-resources/images/englischhilfen_grammatik_cover.png]

[.chapter]
[@id:227753]
[▼ch-1]
[#Simple Past - Complex Tests]

[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:227754]
[%Nr. 4456]
[!Welche Form ist richtig?]
1. she [+was][-were]
2. you [-getted][+got]
3. you [-forgetted][+forgot]
4. we [-understanded][+understood]
5. it [+did][-doed]
6. I [+drank][-drinked]
7. she [-meeted][+met]
8. I [+was][-were]
9. we [-was][+were]
10. they [-spended][+spent]

[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:227755]
[%Nr. 4456]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welche Verbformen stehen im Simple Past?]
[+had]
[-has]
[-plaied]
[+played]
[+was]
[+were]
===
[!2. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Past?]
[+He didn't learn for school.]
[+I fell from the tree.]
[-I've found a pen.]
[+She was in Hamburg.]
[-We were watching a film.]
===
[!3. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Past?]
[+2.Spalte der unregelmäßigen Verben]
[-3. Spalte der unregelmäßigen Verben]
[+Infinitiv + -ed]
[-was/were + Infinitiv + -ing]
===
[!4. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Past?]
[-at the moment]
[+in 2002]
[+two weeks ago]
[-while]
[+yesterday]
===
[!5. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?]
[+lived]
[-liveed]
[-planed]
[+planned]
[+tried]
[-tryed]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Welche Verbformen stehen im Simple Past?
2. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Past?
3. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Past?
4. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Past?
5. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:227756]
[%Nr. 4456]
[!Welche Sätze/Fragen sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welcher Satz steht im __Simple Past__?]
[-She has read a book.]
[+She read a book.]
[-She reads a book.]
===
[!2. In welchem Satz ist das __Simple Past__ richtig eingesetzt?]
[+The hotel room was very nice.]
[-The hotel room were very nice.]
===
[!3. Welcher __verneinte__ Satz steht im __Simple Past__?]
[-They did'nt sing a song.]
[+They didn't sing a song.]
[-They don't sang a song.]
===
[!4. Welche Frage steht im __Simple Past__?]
[-Did you saw her?]
[+Did you see her?]
[-Have you seen her?]
===
[!5. In welchem Satz ist das __Simple Past__ richtig eingesetzt?]
[-Steven forgetted his homework.]
[+Steven forgot his homework.]
[-Steven forgots his homework.]
===
[!6. Welche Frage steht im __Simple Past__?]
[+When did Anne find the keys?]
[-When found Anne the keys?]
===
[!7. Welcher __verneinte__ Satz steht im __Simple Past__?]
[+We did not speak Russian.]
[-We not spoke Russian.]
[-We spoke not Russian.]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Welcher Satz steht im __Simple Past__?
2. In welchem Satz ist das __Simple Past__ richtig eingesetzt?

choices.choice: The hotel room was very nice.
The hotel room were very nice.

quizzes.instruction: 3. Welcher __verneinte__ Satz steht im __Simple Past__?
4. Welche Frage steht im __Simple Past__?
5. In welchem Satz ist das __Simple Past__ richtig eingesetzt?
6. Welche Frage steht im __Simple Past__?

choices.choice: When did Anne find the keys?

quizzes.instruction: 7. Welcher __verneinte__ Satz steht im __Simple Past__?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227757]
[%Nr. 4456]
[!Bilde Fragen im Simple Past.]
1. why / the teacher / to check / the computer
[_Why did the teacher check the computer]?
2. when / you / to watch / the film
[_When did you watch the film]?
3. what / Peggy / to throw
[_What did Peggy throw]?
4. the cat / to run after / the dog
[_Did the cat run after the dog]?
5. why / Julia / to ask / questions
[_Why did Julia ask questions]?
6. where / your father / to repair / the kite
[_Where did your father repair the kite]?
7. how / they / to ride / their bikes
[_How did they ride their bikes]?
8. when / Eric / to phone / his friend
[_When did Eric phone his friend]?
9. what / he / to have / for lunch
[_What did he have for lunch]?
10. to be / the boys / in the sun
[_Were the boys in the sun]?

bit.body:
1. why / the teacher / to check / the computer
{0}?
2. when / you / to watch / the film
{1}?
3. what / Peggy / to throw
{2}?
4. the cat / to run after / the dog
{3}?
5. why / Julia / to ask / questions
{4}?
6. where / your father / to repair / the kite
{5}?
7. how / they / to ride / their bikes
{6}?
8. when / Eric / to phone / his friend
{7}?
9. what / he / to have / for lunch
{8}?
10. to be / the boys / in the sun
{9}?

solutions: Why did the teacher check the computer
When did you watch the film
Did the cat run after the dog
Where did your father repair the kite
How did they ride their bikes
When did Eric phone his friend
What did he have for lunch
Were the boys in the sun

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227758]
[%Nr. 4456]
[!Verneine die vorgegebenen Sätze.]
1. They came out of the house.
[_They did not come out of the house].
2. We ran to the tree house.
[_We did not run to the tree house].
3. My brother made a lot of noise.
[_My brother did not make a lot of noise].
4. The boys swapped comics.
[_The boys did not swap comics].
5. It rained yesterday.
[_It did not rain yesterday].
6. Andrew invited his friends.
[_Andrew did not invite his friends].
7. Phil talked to his parrot.
[_Phil did not talk to his parrot].
8. Lee drew a picture.
[_Lee did not draw a picture].
9. The parents were in the restaurant.
[_The parents were not in the restaurant].
10. She was late this morning.
[_She was not late this morning].

bit.body:
1. They came out of the house.
{0}.
2. We ran to the tree house.
{1}.
3. My brother made a lot of noise.
{2}.
4. The boys swapped comics.
{3}.
5. It rained yesterday.
{4}.
6. Andrew invited his friends.
{5}.
7. Phil talked to his parrot.
{6}.
8. Lee drew a picture.
{7}.
9. The parents were in the restaurant.
{8}.
10. She was late this morning.
{9}.

solutions: They did not come out of the house
We did not run to the tree house
My brother did not make a lot of noise
The boys did not swap comics
Andrew did not invite his friends
Phil did not talk to his parrot
Lee did not draw a picture
The parents were not in the restaurant
She was not late this morning

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227759]
[%Nr. 4456]
[!Setze die Verben in das Simple Past.]
1. we cycle → we [_cycled]
2. we arrive → we [_arrived]
3. they play → they [_played]
4. she visits → she [_visited]
5. you live → you [_lived]
6. I carry → I [_carried]
7. you enjoy → you [_enjoyed]
8. I listen → I [_listened]
9. they work → they [_worked]
10. he tries → he [_tried]

bit.instruction: Setze die Verben in das Simple Past.

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:227760]
[▼ch-2]
[#Simple Past oder Present Perfect – Complex Test]

bit.title: Simple Past oder Present Perfect – Complex Test

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227761]
[%Nr. 4460]
[!Verneine die vorgegebenen Sätze.]
1. You have understood the text.
[_You have not understood the text].
2. She has sent an invitation card.
[_She has not sent an invitation card].
3. Matthew looked after the baby.
[_Matthew did not look after the baby].
4. A thief stole the handbag.
[_A thief did not steal the handbag].
5. The children have cleaned their teeth.
[_The children have not cleaned their teeth].
6. Simon ordered a pizza.
[_Simon did not order a pizza].
7. The pupils were in the gym.
[_The pupils were not in the gym].
8. I woke up at 8 o'clock.
[_I did not wake up at 8 o'clock].
9. We've worked in a snack bar.
[_We have not worked in a snack bar].
10. He has missed the school bus.
[_He has not missed the school bus].

bit.body:
1. You have understood the text.
{0}.
2. She has sent an invitation card.
{1}.
3. Matthew looked after the baby.
{2}.
4. A thief stole the handbag.
{3}.
5. The children have cleaned their teeth.
{4}.
6. Simon ordered a pizza.
{5}.
7. The pupils were in the gym.
{6}.
8. I woke up at 8 o'clock.
{7}.
9. We've worked in a snack bar.
{8}.
10. He has missed the school bus.
{9}.

solutions: You have not understood the text
She has not sent an invitation card
Matthew did not look after the baby
A thief did not steal the handbag
The children have not cleaned their teeth
Simon did not order a pizza
The pupils were not in the gym
I did not wake up at 8 o'clock
We have not worked in a snack bar
He has not missed the school bus

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:227762]
[%Nr. 4460]
[!Signalwörter in Sätzen – Welcher Satz/Welche Frage ist richtig?]
===
[!1.]
[+Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928.]
[-Alexander Fleming just discovered penicillin.]
===
[!2]
[+Have you ever seen a rattlesnake?]
[-Have you seen a rattlesnake yesterday?]
===
[!3.]
[-We already bought this car.]
[+We bought this car in 2003.]
===
[!4.]
[-We have cleaned the car last Thursday.]
[+We have just cleaned the car.]
===
[!5.]
[-Anke ever moved to England.]
[+Anke moved to England in August 2006.]
===
[!6.]
[+They have never written a text message.]
[-They have not written a text message in the last lesson.]
===
[!7.]
[-They just went to town.]
[+They went to town yesterday.]
===
[!8.]
[+My grandmother got up an hour ago.]
[-My grandmother has got up an hour ago.]
===
[!9.]
[+Did he ride his bike two hours ago?]
[-Did he ride his bike yet?]
===
[!10.]
[-I have not visited my uncle two weeks ago.]
[+I have not visited my uncle yet.]
===

bit.instruction: Signalwörter in Sätzen – Welcher Satz/Welche Frage ist richtig?

choices.choice: Have you ever seen a rattlesnake?
Have you seen a rattlesnake yesterday?
We have cleaned the car last Thursday.
We have just cleaned the car.
Anke moved to England in August 2006.
They have never written a text message.
They have not written a text message in the last lesson.
My grandmother got up an hour ago.
My grandmother has got up an hour ago.
Did he ride his bike two hours ago?
Did he ride his bike yet?
I have not visited my uncle two weeks ago.
I have not visited my uncle yet.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227763]
[%Nr. 4460]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken.]
1. The children [_have not cleaned][!not/to clean] their room. It's still dirty.
2. I'm sorry. I [_have forgotten][!to forget] my diary.
3. Two years ago Mary [_visited][!to visit] Bath.
4. They [_have cleaned][!to clean] the bike. It looks new again.
5. Last Monday she [_checked][!to check] her computer.
6. I [_have not been][!not/to be] to Siberia yet.
7. Jack [_broke][!to break] the window of the gym this morning.
8. Yesterday we [_played][!to play] volleyball.
9. [_Have] you ever [_done][!to do] magic tricks?
10. We [_worked][!to work] in a restaurant in May 2001.

bit.body:
1. The children {0} their room. It's still dirty.
2. I'm sorry. I {1} my diary.
3. Two years ago Mary {2} Bath.
4. They {3} the bike. It looks new again.
5. Last Monday she {4} her computer.
6. I {5} to Siberia yet.
7. Jack {6} the window of the gym this morning.
8. Yesterday we {7} volleyball.
9. {8} you ever {9} magic tricks?
10. We {10} in a restaurant in May 2001.
bit.instruction: Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken.

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:227764]
[%Nr. 4460]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Past?]
[-ever]
[+in 2004]
[-just]
[+last week]
[-now]
[+two days ago]
[+yesterday]
===
[!2. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Past?]
[+2. Spalte der unregelmäßigen Verben]
[-had + past participle]
[-have/has + past participle]
[+Infinitiv + -ed]
===
[!3. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Present Perfect?]
[+already]
[+ever]
[+just]
[-last week]
[-tomorrow]
[-yesterday]
[+yet]
===
[!4. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Present Perfect?]
[-2. Spalte der unregelmäßigen Verben]
[-3. Spalte der unregelmäßigen Verben]
[-had + past participle]
[+has + Infinitiv + -ed]
[+have + Infinitiv + -ed]
[+have/has + past participle]
===
[!5. Welche Sätze stehen im Simple Past?]
[-He has read a book.]
[+He read a book.]
[-He reads a book.]
[-I'm listening to music.]
[+I listened to music.]
===
[!6. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Present Perfect?]
[-Did you finish your letter this morning?]
[+Have you finished your letter?]
[-She is reading the book.]
[+She's read the book.]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Past?
2. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Past?
3. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Present Perfect?
4. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Present Perfect?
5. Welche Sätze stehen im Simple Past?
6. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Present Perfect?

responses.response: Did you finish your letter this morning?

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:227765]
[%Nr. 4460]
[!Setze die richtigen Verbformen ein.]
1. Steven [-has never flew][-has never fly][+has never flown] across the Altantic.
2. My father [-forgets][+forgot][-forgotten] his video camera yesterday.
3. We [-have already saw][-have already see][+have already seen] the film at home.
4. They [-haven't take][+haven't taken][-haven't took] their books out yet.
5. When [+did you wake up][-did you woke up][-did you woken up] this morning?
6. [-Did you ever touch][+Have you ever touched] a snake?
7. She [+didn't win][-didn't won]  the contest three years ago.
8. Last week my uncle [-driven][-drives][+drove] a new car.
9. The thieves [-steal][+stole][-stolen] the painting in 1999.
10. I [-have just chose][+have just chosen][-have just choose] the blue pen.

bit.body:
1. Steven {0} across the Altantic.
2. My father {1} his video camera yesterday.
3. We {2} the film at home.
4. They {3} their books out yet.
5. When {4} this morning?
6. {5} a snake?
7. She {6}  the contest three years ago.
8. Last week my uncle {7} a new car.
9. The thieves {8} the painting in 1999.
10. I {9} the blue pen.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:227766]
[%Nr. 4460]
[!Welche Zeitform wird bei folgenden Handlungen verwendet?]
===
[!1. Handlung begann in der Vergangeheit und dauert bis in die Gegenwart]
[+Present Perfect]
[-Simple Past]
===
[!2. Handlung hat in der Vergangenheit begonnen und ist abgeschlossen]
[-Present Perfect]
[+Simple Past]
===
[!3. Resultat einer Handlung ist in der Gegenwart wichtig]
[+Present Perfect]
[-Simple Past]
===

bit.instruction: Welche Zeitform wird bei folgenden Handlungen verwendet?

quizzes.instruction: 1. Handlung begann in der Vergangeheit und dauert bis in die Gegenwart
2. Handlung hat in der Vergangenheit begonnen und ist abgeschlossen
3. Resultat einer Handlung ist in der Gegenwart wichtig

bitmark:
[.chapter]
[@id:227767]
[▼ch-3]
[#Simple Present – Complex Test 1]

[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227768]
[%Nr. 4450]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken ein.]
1. The pupils [_sing][!to sing] songs in the classroom.
2. The boys [_do not play][!not/to play] computer games.
3. Peter [_does not write][!not/to write] e-mails.
4. [_Does] she [_collect][!to collect] stamps?
5. She [_is][!to be] my sister.
6. I often [_go][!to go] to the cinema.
7. Andy's brother [_works][!to work] in an office.
8. Jill [_has][!to have] two children.
9. She [_flies][!to fly] to Menorca every summer.
10. [_Do] you [_speak][!to speak] English?

bit.body:
1. The pupils {0} songs in the classroom.
2. The boys {1} computer games.
3. Peter {2} e-mails.
4. {3} she {4} stamps?
5. She {5} my sister.
6. I often {6} to the cinema.
7. Andy's brother {7} in an office.
8. Jill {8} two children.
9. She {9} to Menorca every summer.
10. {10} you {11} English?
bit.instruction: Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken ein.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:227769]
[%Nr. 4450]
[!Welche Sätze/Fragen sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welche Frage steht im Simple Present?]
[-Do she work in an office?]
[-Do she works in an office?]
[+Does she work in an office?]
[-Work she in an office?]
[-Works she in an office?]
===
[!2. Welche Frage steht im Simple Present?]
[-From where do you come?]
[+Where do you come from?]
[-Where does you come from?]
[-Where dos you come from?]
===
[!3. Welcher Satz steht im Simple Present?]
[-He has read a book.]
[-He is reading a book.]
[-He read a book.]
[+He reads a book.]
[-He will read a book.]
===
[!4. In welchem Satz ist das Simple Present richtig eingesetzt?]
[-Andrew wash the dishes.]
[-Andrew washs the dishes.]
[+Andrew washes the dishes.]
===
[!5. In welchem Satz ist das Simple Present richtig eingesetzt?]
[-Carol clean the bathroom.]
[+Carol cleans the bathroom.]
===
[!6. Welcher verneinte Satz steht im Simple Present?]
[-He do not reads a book.]
[+He does not read a book.]
[-He is not reading a book.]
[-He not read a book.]
===
[!7. Welcher Satz steht im Simple Present?]
[-He can a bike ride.]
[+He can ride a bike.]
[-He can rides a bike.]
[-He cans ride a bike.]
===
[!8. Welcher verneinte Satz steht im Simple Present?]
[-We does not work in a bank.]
[+We don't work in a bank.]
[-We do'nt work in a bank.]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Welche Frage steht im Simple Present?

choices.choice: Do she work in an office?
Do she works in an office?
Does she work in an office?

quizzes.instruction: 2. Welche Frage steht im Simple Present?
3. Welcher Satz steht im Simple Present?
4. In welchem Satz ist das Simple Present richtig eingesetzt?
5. In welchem Satz ist das Simple Present richtig eingesetzt?
6. Welcher verneinte Satz steht im Simple Present?

choices.choice: He do not reads a book.
He does not read a book.
He is not reading a book.

quizzes.instruction: 7. Welcher Satz steht im Simple Present?
8. Welcher verneinte Satz steht im Simple Present?

choices.choice: We does not work in a bank.
We don't work in a bank.
We do'nt work in a bank.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227770]
[%Nr. 4450]
[!Verneine die vorgegebenen Sätze.]
1. Mr Smith teaches French.
[_Mr Smith does not teach French.].
2. Kevin plays basketball.
[_Kevin does not play basketball].
3. She sits on a chair.
[_She does not sit on a chair].
4. The children know the answer.
[_The children do not know the answer].
5. Steve can make breakfast.
[_Steve cannot make breakfast].
6. Anne and Sue carry a box.
[_Anne and Sue do not carry a box].
7. He is from Spain.
[_He is not from Spain].
8. I run to school.
[_I do not run to school].
9. The kite flies into the air.
[_The kite does not fly into the air].
10. Sandy washes her hair.
[_Sandy does not wash her hair].

bit.body:
1. Mr Smith teaches French.
{0}.
2. Kevin plays basketball.
{1}.
3. She sits on a chair.
{2}.
4. The children know the answer.
{3}.
5. Steve can make breakfast.
{4}.
6. Anne and Sue carry a box.
{5}.
7. He is from Spain.
{6}.
8. I run to school.
{7}.
9. The kite flies into the air.
{8}.
10. Sandy washes her hair.
{9}.

solutions: Mr Smith does not teach French.
She does not sit on a chair
The children do not know the answer
Anne and Sue do not carry a box
I do not run to school
The kite does not fly into the air
Sandy does not wash her hair

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:227771]
[%Nr. 4450]
[!Setze die richtigen Verbformen ein.]
1. Andy [-wash][+washes][-washs] the family car.
2. The girls [+do][-does][-dos] the shopping.
3. Mr. Black [-write][+writes][-writs] e-mails in the evenings.
4. [+Am][-Are][-Be][-Is] I correct?
5. Mandy and Susan [+watch][-watches][-watchs] films every weekend.
6. John often [-play][-playes][+plays] handball.
7. It [-am][-are][-be][+is] a beautiful day today.
8. Do you [+like][-likes][-liks] milk in your tea?
9. Every morning my mother [-get up][-get ups][+gets up] at 6 o'clock.
10. His friend [-go][+goes][-gos] to school.

bit.body:
1. Andy {0} the family car.
2. The girls {1} the shopping.
3. Mr. Black {2} e-mails in the evenings.
4. {3} I correct?
5. Mandy and Susan {4} films every weekend.
6. John often {5} handball.
7. It {6} a beautiful day today.
8. Do you {7} milk in your tea?
9. Every morning my mother {8} at 6 o'clock.
10. His friend {9} to school.

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:227772]
[%Nr. 4450]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Present?]
[-have + infinitive + -ed]
[+infinitive]
[-infinitive + -ed]
[+infinitive + s]
[-infinitive + -ing]
[-have + infinitive + -ed]
===
[!2. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?]
[-she are]
[+she has]
[-she hase]
[+she is]
[-she plaies]
[+she plays]
===
[!3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?]
[+Do you speak Spanish?]
[+He's 15.]
[+I'm in room 201.]
[-She didn't help her mother.]
[+She doesn't like milk.]
[+She drives a car.]
[-We are reading a book.]
===
[!4. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?]
[+he flies]
[-he flys]
[-he livees]
[+he lives]
[-he workes]
[+he works]
===
[!5. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?]
[-always]
[-at the moment]
[+every day]
[-now]
[+often]
[+sometimes]
[-yesterday]
===
[!6. Welche Verben/Hilfsverben können direkt verneint werden?]
[+am]
[+are]
[+can]
[+is]
[-play]
[-read]
[-speak]
===
[!3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?]
[+Do you speak Spanish?]
[+He's 15.]
[+I'm in room 201.]
[-She didn't help her mother.]
[+She doesn't like milk.]
[+She drives a car.]
[-We are reading a book.]
===
[!4. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?]
[+he flies]
[-he flys]
[-he livees]
[+he lives]
[-he workes]
[+he works]
===
[!5. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?]
[-always]
[-at the moment]
[+every day]
[-now]
[+often]
[+sometimes]
[-yesterday]
===
[!6. Welche Verben/Hilfsverben können direkt verneint werden?]
[+am]
[+are]
[+can]
[+is]
[-play]
[-read]
[-speak]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Present?
2. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?
3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?
4. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?
5. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?
6. Welche Verben/Hilfsverben können direkt verneint werden?
3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?
4. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?
5. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?
6. Welche Verben/Hilfsverben können direkt verneint werden?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:227773]
[%Nr. 4450]
[!Bilde Fragen.]
1. can / Ron / to speak / English
[_Can Ron speak English]?
2. how / Linda / to go / to the park
[_How does Linda go to the park]?
3. when / his mum / to come / home
[_When does his mum come home]?
4. where / she / to live
[_Where does she live]?
5. what / they / to eat / for breakfast
[_What do they eat for breakfast]?
6. Marie and Joe / to like / homework
[_Do Marie and Joe like homework]?
7. Frank / to read / comics
[_Does Frank read comics]?
8. you / to walk / to school
[_Do you walk to school]?
9. why / you / to ride / your bike
[_Why do you ride your bike]?
10. to be / Peter / from Austria
[_Is Peter from Austria]?

bit.body:
1. can / Ron / to speak / English
{0}?
2. how / Linda / to go / to the park
{1}?
3. when / his mum / to come / home
{2}?
4. where / she / to live
{3}?
5. what / they / to eat / for breakfast
{4}?
6. Marie and Joe / to like / homework
{5}?
7. Frank / to read / comics
{6}?
8. you / to walk / to school
{7}?
9. why / you / to ride / your bike
{8}?
10. to be / Peter / from Austria
{9}?

solutions: How does Linda go to the park
When does his mum come home
What do they eat for breakfast
Do Marie and Joe like homework
Why do you ride your bike
